DOC.HEADLINE: Wall Street mixed amid economic concerns

TEXT.P: Wall Street opened mixed Friday, as investors worried the economic slowdown may be prolonged.

Chevron Corp. slid, after the second biggest U.S. energy producer said the falling dollar slashed overseas profit. International Business Machines Corp. lost ground as Goldman Sachs downgraded the shares to "neutral".
Investors were also worried ahead of the reading on consumers' sentiment in July. The Reuters/University of Michigan will reveal its index of consumer sentiment at 10 a.m. EST.
The Dow Jones fell 31.29 to 8,151.88. Broader indexes moved mixed. The Standard & Poor's 500 index declined 3.18 to 879.50; and the Nasdaq added 4.09 to 1,756.64.
